subject: p15114531
History: Year old woman status post R hemicolectomy presents with abdominal pain and several days of cough, treated with empiric levofloxacin for possible pneumonia, chest x-rays have been clear, would like to assess if theres new consolidation given persistent cough.
Findings: There is a left PICC which terminates within the upper SVC. The lungs are clear of focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax. The heart size is normal. The mediastinal contours are normal.
Impression: No acute cardiopulmonary process. Left PICC terminates within the proximal SVC.
